content.description: Start on the obvious crimp, then to a big left-hand reach to a side pull, move hands up to jugs, and use an awkward heel pull to top out. The first move is probably harder for shorter climbers
content.location: Obvious boulder at Panoramic Point. There's a large tree next to it that shades the top in the afternoon and evening. If it's a busy season you'll probably have some spectators

content.description: First section before the glory hand crack is chossy (imagine climbing a mountain of Rice Krispies). Hand crack is clean with a couple large avoidable loose blocks. Chossy but easy top out.
content.location: See description for Over-Width. This climb is on the same rock, slightly downhill.

content.description: Follow the flake system up the center of the steep side of boulder
content.location: Park at the Panoramic Point trailhead 2 miles from the Grant Grove visitor center. Take the paved panoramic point trailhead past the scenic lookout overlooking Kings Canyon and the many peaks of the Sierra Nevada. After passing the "view" continue on the trail for 1/8th of a mile and the boulder will be obvious on the right side of the trail.

content.description: Wide crack with the crux within the first couple moves. Easy walk off or easily accessed anchors for TR
content.location: Park at the Panoramic Point trailhead 2 miles from the Grant Grove visitor center. Take the paved panoramic point trailhead past the scenic lookout overlooking Kings Canyon and the many peaks of the Sierra Nevada. After passing the "view" continue on the trail for 1/8th of a mile and the crack will be on the left side of the trail and on the downhill side of a pile of boulders

content.description: Start on Sheeple, but hand traverse left along the horizontal crack. Make some hard slab moves to get our feet up to the horizontal. Breath and finish on good feet to a top out that is pretty high off the ground.
content.protection: A good sized pad and maybe a spotter.
content.location: On Park Ridge Trail, the obvious tall boulder a quarter mile or so down the trail from Panoramic Point.

content.description: Easy but fun and the top out is a little high off the ground. This line follows the obvious (suspect) flake system up the right arete of the Sheeple boulder. Feet tend to be great, but you may have to get creative for hands if you are shorter.
content.location: Rightmost climb on the Sheeple boulder. Located about a quarter mile down trail from Panoramic Point.
